finished.translation[0].definitions[0].d: no longer doing, dealing with, or using something
finished.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Are you finished with my tools yet?
finished.translation[0].definitions[1].d: fully and properly made or completed
finished.translation[0].definitions[1].e: It took a long time to do, but the finished product was worth it.
The painting began to look like the finished article.
finished.translation[0].definitions[2].d: no longer successful, effective, or able to continue
finished.translation[0].definitions[2].e: If the bank refuses to increase our loan, we’re finished!
finished.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: if something is finished, you have done all of it
She showed him the finished drawing.
I was very pleased with the finished result.
finished – used especially in everyday English instead of finished
I can’t come out till my essay’s done.
They promised the work would be done by April.
completely finished – used especially to emphasize that there is no more work to do
Six months later the job was complete.
The first stage of the project is now complete.
finished – used about an event, activity, or period of time
Football practice is over at 4:30. Can you pick me up then?
to have finished doing something or using something
I probably won’t be through till about 6 o'clock.
Are you through with those scissors?
